author: cbs8
title: The Top All-Inclusive Caribbean Resorts for Labor Day Rated by Booking.com Travelers
text:
Booking.com
Labor Day Doesn't Have to be Laboring with these Top Caribbean All-Inclusive Resorts Selected by Booking.com
NEW YORK , Aug. 19, Labor day is a few weeks away and choosing where to go for a relaxing break from life has just become less laboring. More than 54 million verified guest reviews on Booking.com reveal the top Caribbean all-inclusive resorts travelers should consider for a carefree Labor Day holiday.
Each of the following all-inclusive resorts offer luxurious spa treatments, delectable cuisine options and awe-inspiring tropical beaches on which to relax and bask in the sunshine. From swim up rooms, ocean view balconies and on-demand concierge services, to local eco-adventures and on-site ice cream parlors, there are no better paradise escapes to help you unwind.
All of the highlighted properties can be booked directly on the Booking.com website or by downloading the Booking.com mobile app, available for download on the App Store or Google Play .
Hyatt Ziva Rose Hall
Montego Bay, Jamaica
Set on one of the Caribbean's most pristine beaches at the foot of some of Jamaica's most luscious and picturesque mountains, Hyatt Ziva Rose Hall offers some of the most stunning views imaginable. Booking.com guests love this paradise resort for its tranquil setting, genuine and exemplary service, and gourmet cuisine offerings at the eight onsite restaurants.
Zoetry Agua
Punta Cana, Dominican Republic
Located on a dazzling stretch of Caribbean coastline, Zoetry Agua Punta Cana boasts an indulgent experience set amidst an exquisite property rife with a beautiful natural contemporary design. Booking.com guests most enjoy pampering themselves with soothing, revitalizing treatments performed by the spa's attentive and expertly trained therapists.
Sea Breeze Beach Hotel
Christ Church, Barbados
Relax poolside among the palm and coconut trees within the lush tropical gardens of Sea Breeze Beach Hotel, or enjoy plunging your toes into the sand on one of the resort's two charming beaches. The staff's gracious hospitality and attentiveness, and magnificent ocean views from the resort's three onsite restaurants were very memorable among Booking.com guests.
Cocobay Resort
Antigua & Barbuda
Located on 10 gorgeous acres and overlooking Freyes Bay, Cocobay Resort features airy cottages with private balconies and spectacular views. Snorkeling, kayaking and sailing are just some of the many activities available to guests on the resort's private beach. Booking.com guests have most enjoyed the tranquillity and comfort the resort offers.
Buccament Bay Resort
Saint Vincent & Grenadines
Situated on a sandy private beach in Kingstown and surrounded by mountains, Buccament Bay Resort features stylish and contemporary villas with private plunge pools. The resort also boasts onsite boutique shops, a soccer and tennis school, an infinity pool and a full-service spa. Booking.com guests have raved about the exceptional facilities and surreal ocean views.
About Booking.com :
Booking.com is the world leader in booking hotel and other accommodations online. It guarantees the best prices for any type of property – from small independents to five-star luxury. Guests can access the Booking.com website anytime, anywhere from their desktops, mobile phones and tablet devices, and they don't pay booking fees – ever. The Booking.com website is available in 42 languages, offers over 715,000 hotels and accommodations including more than 315,000 vacation rental properties and covers over 82,000 destinations in 221 countries and territories worldwide. It features over 54 million reviews written by guests after their stay, and attracts online visitors from both leisure and business markets around the globe. With over 17 years of experience and a team of over 9,300 dedicated employees in 165 offices worldwide, Booking.com operates its own in-house customer service team, which is available 24/7 to assist guests in their native languages and ensure an exceptional customer experience.
Established in 1996, Booking.com B.V. owns and operates Booking.com™, and is part of The Priceline Group (NASDAQ: PCLN). Follow us on Twitter , Google+ and Pinterest , like us on Facebook , or learn more at http://www.booking.com .
